field.comment: If you know the process beforehand, we don't need to do guessing logic
field.name: processInstanceId

structure.comment:
An action can be linked to one or more parent actions. It can only be executed if all the parent actions have been completed. This means for multiple parents a "join" in BPMN terminology
Note that you can also have an inverse relationship, this means the target action must NOT have been executed yet.
For instance on a particular action you want the user to do something and have an offshoot (with delay) of a reminder mail. The reminder mail must only trigger if the user has not taken action yet. This means the reminder mail has an inverse relationship to the user action
structure.name: applicableRelations

structure.comment:
An action can be linked to one or more parent actions. It can only be executed if all the parent actions have been completed. This means for multiple parents a "join" in BPMN terminology
Note that you can also have an inverse relationship, this means the target action must NOT have been executed yet.
For instance on a particular action you want the user to do something and have an offshoot (with delay) of a reminder mail. The reminder mail must only trigger if the user has not taken action yet. This means the reminder mail has an inverse relationship to the user action
structure.name: incomingFlows

structure.comment:
An action can be linked to one or more parent actions. It can only be executed if all the parent actions have been completed. This means for multiple parents a "join" in BPMN terminology
Note that you can also have an inverse relationship, this means the target action must NOT have been executed yet.
For instance on a particular action you want the user to do something and have an offshoot (with delay) of a reminder mail. The reminder mail must only trigger if the user has not taken action yet. This means the reminder mail has an inverse relationship to the user action
structure.name: outgoingFlows

structure.comment: When you have a repeatable action that has child actions, when the child actions occur, they are linked to the LAST unlockedinstance of the parent. For example: check a particular remote state (e.g. document signature) until it is signed, then we can continue.
structure.name: potentialAction

structure.comment:
An action can be linked to one or more parent actions. It can only be executed if all the parent actions have been completed. This means for multiple parents a "join" in BPMN terminology
Note that you can also have an inverse relationship, this means the target action must NOT have been executed yet.
For instance on a particular action you want the user to do something and have an offshoot (with delay) of a reminder mail. The reminder mail must only trigger if the user has not taken action yet. This means the reminder mail has an inverse relationship to the user action
structure.name: potentialRelations

structure.comment: When you have a repeatable action that has child actions, when the child actions occur, they are linked to the LAST unlockedinstance of the parent. For example: check a particular remote state (e.g. document signature) until it is signed, then we can continue.
structure.name: sourceAction
